intro: Glossoloma tetragonum, commonly known as the four-angled nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features distinctive quadrangular stems and small, clustered flowers that are usually purple or violet in color. Its leaves are opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Glossoloma tetragonum is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
